The vessel you choose significantly influences your sip experience through a combination of science and sensory perception.
Any drink that you'd serve straight up can go in a coupe, shaken or stirred, without any ice.
Typically wide-brimmed with a thick base, making it easy to muddle berries or other ingredients before the main liquid is added.
Ideal for serving sparkling beverages, the long, upright bowl successfully retains carbonation and captures flavor.
Used to serve drinks that contain a large proportion of a mixer, and are poured over ice.
